em.strong: The mission of Thompson Public School is to develop life-long learners and responsible citizens.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: April 18-26 will be considered a full closure of the school campus.

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h2.div: There will be no office hours, school lunches, or staff access to the building during this week.

div.p: If you cannot fully access the information on any web page of this site, please let us know the accessibility issue you are having by contacting Scott Conrad, Technology Department at (701) 599-2765 or by e-mail at scott.conrad@tps-k12.org. We will try to provide the information to you in an alternate format and/or make the necessary improvements to make the information accessible. If you would like to file a formal grievance under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, you may contact our Section 504 coordinator, Scott Conrad, at 424 3rd St, Thompson, ND, 58278, at (701) 599-2765, or by e-mail at scott.conrad@tps-k12.org.

Thompson School District is working on making changes to its website to ensure it is accessible to persons with disabilities. We'd like to know how the website is or isn't accessible to you. If you would be willing to share your thoughts, we would appreciate it. To submit any comments, please contact Susan Hahn at Thompson School, (701) 599-2765, susan.hahn@tps-k12.org.

div.p: Thompson Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or age in its programs or activities, and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies: Jason Schwabe, High School Principal, 424 3rd St, Thompson, ND, 58278, at (701) 599-2765, or by email at jason.schwabe@tps-k12.org.
